content.description:
P1. Start under a roof and reach up to a hand crack. Follow the crack to a ledge and a small tree with slings.

P2. The first half of this pitch climbs through some pretty soft and loose rock then follows a right-angling, right-facing crack to a large tree.

These pitches can easily be combined.

Descent - either rappel from a tree with slings to the right of the route, or rappel from a bolted anchor at the top of

Redacted

.
content.protection: A standard rack with doubles of #0.75 - #2 Camalot.
content.location:
This is towards the center of the Maxx area, around the corner to the left from

Texas Sucks

and

Redacted

.

content.description: Climb the choss arete to the roof entering the right-facing corner to a ledge, and do some scary moves to the start of the crack, which is followed to the top.  Classic.
content.protection: This is totally scary if you don't stick clip the first bolt in the corner.  Bring draws and hand-sized gear.  It needs fixed anchor to prevent rope jamming in the crack at the top.
content.location: This is around the corner, right of Byrd's.

content.description: Starts by climbing up through some devious looking wedged blocks/flakes, then step right under a small roof and follow the left-angling crack to a tree anchor.
content.location:
It is on the right side of the Maxx area, just right of

Sunflower Crack

and left of

Redacted

.
